titles.title: Social Security Benefits Tax Relief Act of 2009
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the 1993 income tax increase on Social Security benefits.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 3/16/2009--Introduced. Social Security Benefits Tax Relief Act of 2009 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal the 85 percent maximum tax rate on Social Security and Railroad Retirement benefits enacted by the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993. Appropriates, from the general fund, to the Hospital Insurance Trust Fund amounts equal to the reduction in revenues resulting from this repeal.
